name: Swarnava Sarkar
position: MSCF Candidate at Carnegie Mellon | ex-MTS @ Oracle | IIT Kharagpur '22

current_company.name: Oracle
current_company.title: MSCF Candidate at Carnegie Mellon | ex-MTS @ Oracle | IIT Kharagpur '22

experience.title: Member of Technical Staff
experience.description: • Designed and developed software tools and libraries for OCI's Python software development kit, which allows our customers to build scalable applications that work seamlessly with Oracle's cloud services.• Implemented a new authentication method for the Python software development kit to allow applications running on Kubernetes clusters to authenticate against Oracle Cloud and communicate with it.• Designed and implemented a Python automation tool to periodically scan Oracle's internal code repositories and isolate those having vulnerabilities, enhancing security and reliability. Mentored two interns as part of this project.• Recognized for demonstrating the OCI Value ‘Own Without Ego,’ which reflects an individual’s commitment to taking responsibility for team well-being, championing valuable ideas, and promoting a collaborative environment.
experience.description_html: • Designed and developed software tools and libraries for OCI's Python software development kit, which allows our customers to build scalable applications that work seamlessly with Oracle's cloud services.• Implemented a new authentication method for the Python software development kit to allow applications running on Kubernetes clusters to authenticate against Oracle Cloud and communicate with it.• Designed and implemented a Python automation tool to periodically scan Oracle's internal code repositories and isolate those having vulnerabilities, enhancing security and reliability. Mentored two interns as part of this project.• Recognized for demonstrating the OCI Value ‘Own Without Ego,’ which reflects an individual’s commitment to taking responsibility for team well-being, championing valuable ideas, and promoting a collaborative environment.

experience.title: Server Technology Intern
experience.description: • Spearheaded the optimization of OCI's log analytics tool, streamlining the collection and analysis of logs from cloud-hosted compute instances. • Re-engineered the tool entirely in Golang, introducing parallel log collection through Golang’s go-routines.• Achieved a remarkable 67% reduction in CPU consumption and memory footprint, resulting in a 200% boost in overall tool efficiency. • Recognized for outstanding contributions with the award of a pre-placement offer, highlighting internship success.
experience.description_html: • Spearheaded the optimization of OCI's log analytics tool, streamlining the collection and analysis of logs from cloud-hosted compute instances. • Re-engineered the tool entirely in Golang, introducing parallel log collection through Golang’s go-routines.• Achieved a remarkable 67% reduction in CPU consumption and memory footprint, resulting in a 200% boost in overall tool efficiency. • Recognized for outstanding contributions with the award of a pre-placement offer, highlighting internship success.

volunteer_experience.info:
• Enrolled as a cadet in the National Cadet Corps (NCC) for two academic years during college. NCC cadets are trained to serve the nation, be it during disasters, wars or to help out the poor and needy. As such, took part in several social service campaigns. • Organized a blood donation campaign within the institute that attracted nearly 60 donors. Secured a partnership with a local blood bank to collect donors’ blood and provided necessary logistical support for smooth operation.•…

          • Enrolled as a cadet in the National Cadet Corps (NCC) for two academic years during college. NCC cadets are trained to serve the nation, be it during disasters, wars or to help out the poor and needy. As such, took part in several social service campaigns. • Organized a blood donation campaign within the institute that attracted nearly 60 donors. Secured a partnership with a local blood bank to collect donors’ blood and provided necessary logistical support for smooth operation.• Initiated cleanliness drives in nearby villages to help clean them up and promote the importance of health and cleanliness among villagers.

projects: [{"title":"ML Model For User Authentication Using Keystroke Dynamics","start_date":"Aug 2021","end_date":"Nov 2021","description":"• Developed a machine-learning model to authenticate users using their keystroke dynamics as a real-time biometric. • Engineered a Python library containing algorithms to preprocess raw keystroke data and extract quantifiable features, such as typing speed, pauses, etc.• Implemented the model using the kNN algorithm on the generated feature vectors, achieving a model accuracy of 85%. • Led a five-student team for the project. Coordinated different aspects of the project to ensure timely progress."},{"title":"Reinforcement Learning based Autonomous Driving System","start_date":"Aug 2021","end_date":"Nov 2021","description":"• Modeled and trained an autonomous driving system driven by reinforcement learning using MATLAB, encompassing vital functions such as self-navigation, path planning, and obstacle avoidance.• Conducted extensive simulations and testing within MATLAB’s environment, ensuring the reliability and safety of the autonomous system across various scenarios."}]
